hello and greetings from Saale-Unstrut today we 
are visiting the northernmost of germany's 13

wine growing regions which sits along the 51st 
parallel north the wine history here dates back

over a thousand years with the first vines being 
cultivated by monks in the year 998 a.d and it's

as picturesque a destination as you can find 
this is a place where terrace vineyards come

spilling down the hills where medieval castles 
sit atop cliffs and where churches stand guard in

the heart of the old town we've said it before and 
we'll say it again germany has some pretty magical

destinations to discover so without further ado 
the following is our travel guide to Saale-Unstrut

for visitors looking to have an action-packed 
and wine fuel day good morning good morning

guys greetings once again from germany today

yeah just wind by the glass it's pretty amazing

and creating a little souvenir of our own

so we've got that fun activity coming up yeah

so we started the morning with a guided 
walk through the town of freyburg

which is considered the wine capital of the region 
we found the town to be super walkable and full of

charm with lots of cheerful pastel shades vines 
crawling up the side of buildings and rooftops

with eye-shaped windows that kind of made it 
feel like you were being watched from above

we also popped into saint marion for a visit 
which is the lutheran church in the center of town

it is considered the little sister of naumbu 
cathedral which we will show you later in the

day but back to the sightseeing one thing that 
really caught our attention during our walk was

that we were surrounded by vineyards vineyards 
and more vineyards yes we knew we were visiting

a wine town but i don't think either one of us 
expected the vines to be right in the town and

so accessible all right how are we doing 
over there we've had a great walking tour

of the town so far so many historic buildings to 
visit but what impresses me the most is just how

the vineyards come spilling into the town like 
we are right on the we were just walking down

a path and then we suddenly came upon this 
we looked up and like wow it's spectacular

it just gives this town such a a distinct 
a distinct backdrop i would say yeah

and speaking of wine that morning we also visited 
hotkepien mum a winery that dates back to 1856 and

specializes in sparkling wines hot gepin mum 
makes up nearly half the market for sparkling

wine in germany and they're also one of the five 
largest producers of sparkling wine in the world

they do offer tours in german but another option 
if you don't speak the language is to just visit

the shop and peruse their various sparkling wine 
offerings because certain bottles can only be

all right guys so we drove up to the abbey church

the whole valley with the river that flows

from the saale river and the unstruct and 
you can see cute little villages and towns

freyburg where we were this morning is just back

that i would love to do someday to go visit the

two of us doing that oh yes the two cyclists and 
the family we'd probably be taking naps along the

along the trail after every bottle this is 
probably a good time to tell you that cycling

trips are really popular in this area so if your 
idea of a really good holiday is cycling through

scenic countryside hopping from one winery to the 
next and stumbling upon a few castles along the

way well this is the place and it has hundreds 
of kilometers of bike paths along the zale

and unscott rivers but as for us we were here to 
drink some wine so let's take you to our next stop

for lunch we visited hertzoglihel weinberg 
which is a terraced vineyard that has been

preserved in the style of a baroque 
vineyard from the late 18th century

it sits at the foot of the unstruct river and 
it has neurenberg castle watching over it from

the hilltop this may very well be one of the most 
scenic vineyards we have ever visited some of the

grapes you can find in this vineyard include 
pinot blanc sylvaner and pinot noir plus they

also offer a picnic lunch to accompany their wines 
which makes for a really nice quick meal on the go

so lunch time and we are having 
a picnic at a vineyard how's that

oh this is amazing we've got olives both colors 
black and green we've got slices of salami

stuffed peppers with cheese little tomatoes 
well and some bread to go along with it and

the star of course is the peanut butter the 
very famous wine from this area let's try that

oh and they gave us a nice big glass gotta

beautiful beautiful tasting dry white wine 
(wein) from here so sam is normally a red

wine drinker this is unusual for you to be 
trying some white i'm learning to appreciate

whites more on this trip we've been i 
mean germany is famous for its white so

i wouldn't say it's an acquired taste i love 
wines of all flavors and colors yeah this is

this is definitely a good one so let's 
also try a little bit of a bite here

it's a perfect way to spend an afternoon 
here in germany sipping on wine

local wine i should add and 
having a nice tasty snack

afterwards we couldn't resist going to neuenberg 
castle for a closer look so we drove up to the top

this castle was built around the year 1090 by the 
turingian count ludwig the leaper and yes there is

a story behind his name according to local legend 
which may have been quite embellished over time

after stabbing a ruling count and then being 
incarcerated ludwig the leaper leapt from a castle

tower into the river where a servant was waiting 
for him with a boat and his favorite white horse

named swan where he made his perfect escape 
sounds like the stuff of german fairy tales i know

but either way it was a cool castle 
to visit with equally impressive views

next up we continue to the nearby town of naumbuk 
to visit the cathedral which not too long ago

was recognized as a unesco world heritage site 
also known as the cathedral of saint peter and

saint paul this is considered one of europe's 
most important cultural monuments from the high

middle ages and what makes it unique is that 
it's the only church in the world to contain

two choir screens from the high medieval period 
the main attraction is definitely the west choir

which features 12 statues depicting the church's 
top donors dating back to the mid 13th century

these statues were crafted by a medieval stone 
sculptor now only known as the noun bulk master

the most famous statue of all is uttar which 
is said to depict the most beautiful woman of

the middle ages and rumor has it she may have 
also been the inspiration for the evil queen in

disney snow white during our guided visit of nambu 
cathedral we got to climb up a spiraling staircase

that led to the attic which then led to one of the 
towers where you can enjoy views of the town below
so

we also toured the cathedral treasury vault 
which is one of the largest romanesque

vaults in central germany and houses sacral 
works of art all in all a really cool visit

then for afternoon activity we drove to a 
broken lunch medium for a foraging workshop
